page.title: 12Kitchens and Roof Rafters
page.content:
{Purbeck Kitchens}design and build kitchens units, and also build beds. Purbeck Kitchens employ {thirty-two people.}They make five kitchens a day. They make kitchens from wood such as Oak, Beech and Pine. The factory was built in 1982. Their kitchens are sold as far as Bristol. Their beds go abroad to Germany and U.S.A. The kitchens are very modern.
{HY Arnolds}make{roof-rafters.}We found that they had eleven people working on the machines. They work all through the year. They open at eight o'clock and close at half past four. The wood is called European white wood from Finland and Swedan. There is 25 tonnes pressure on one machine. They have two computers in the factory, which are used to design the{rafters.}
